utterance.content: I’m not gonna throw in my phone card.

utterance.speaker: Diane
utterance.content: Can I play?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: Diane
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want to see if you’ve got what it takes. Give me your best poker face. Too rich for my blood. You can take my seat.

utterance.speaker: Safer
utterance.content: Med time!

utterance.speaker: Safer
utterance.content: How are you feeling today?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better than yesterday, not as good as tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve been humming to her. She sways. It might be significant. Are you ignoring me or are you just letting my charm wash over you.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Kind of tough to play and chat. A couple of weeks ago you told me playing to her was a complete waste of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re right. Your playing does get worse when you talk. I assume she loved music.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: She played for the Philadelphia Philharmonic – cello.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if she responded to the piano, she might respond even better to the cello.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: I play a little. Hmm. Maybe I’ll bring one in on Tuesday. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Different desk. Different doctor.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: You’ve been on meds for a while now. I’ll be checking in with you periodically to see if we need to adjust your dose. Any dry mouth, trouble sleeping?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. Can I go now? There’s a manic out there with a fresh carton of cigarettes, and he’s a terrible bluffer.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: It’s nice to see that you and Alvie are friends again. Tell me about your fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He hit me. I hit him back. Repeat until pulpy.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Alvie told me you instigated the thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that tends to be the way fights work – different interpretations of the same circumstances.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Very understanding attitude.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s that tone again.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: You’re smart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How come every time you compliment me, it sounds like an accusation?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: You’re not having any side effects from your meds, which is unusual.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not that unusual.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: The story about the fight isn’t adding up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why don’t you stop pretending that you haven’t reached a conclusion? You don’t trust me. Actually, it’s more fundamental than that. You don’t like me.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: I didn’t say that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think I’m not taking my meds.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. So what do you want me to do? Want me to take a urine test? Will that earn your trust?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Actually, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Have at it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A little dignity, please.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: You know the rules. I have to watch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, but you don’t have to have courtside seats. Can I at least use a stall?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For he himself has said it, and it’s greatly to his credit, that he is an Englishman. He i-i-i-i-is an Englishman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get it while it’s hot.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: I’m sorry I doubted you.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Freedom Master, think you could help me out?

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: You need help? Of – of course. That’s –

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Great. Could you move the piano for me? It’s 500 pounds. That’s not too much, is it?

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Well, is there something trapped underneath or…?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: No. I just want to move it away from the window.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: I’m sorry. My powers aren’t for frivolous –

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Just one quick lift.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you doing that?

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: House, it’s none of your business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m just curious. As a doctor, What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Either he is Freedom Master, and he shouldn’t be here, or else he’s suffering from a serious and dangerous delusion that he needs to deal with.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… legit medical reasons. You’re not just trying to break the guy because he’s a little different.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: He’s not different. He’s delusional. Can you help me out?

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: What is she looking at?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: You’re not a superhero, Steven. You’re just a regular person.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: I can save her.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: That’s okay. We’re… we’re all just regular people. It’s what we do.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: They stole her voice box. They have it in there. That’s what she’s staring at. That’s what she’s staring at. She’s always staring –

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Your wife is dead.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Good can defeat evil.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Not every time. Evil people killed a lot of good people that day. You couldn’t save her. No one could save her.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: It’s in there. Her voice is in there. Her voice is in there.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Code gray.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Her voice is in there. Her voice is in there! Her voice is in there. No! No!

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: Don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m not doing anything.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: You’re thinking. Thins go from thinking to doing way too fast in this place. You keep thinking, you’re gonna wind up with no mo in your mojo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m thinking of hitting you again.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: You hate Medina. You hate all of them. You want to hurt them. You got to keep pretending. Step away from the hate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What’s the difference between pretending to cooperate and cooperating?

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: Pretending is pretending. It’s not real. You don’t mean it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I sat and watched while he did something stupid and pointless. I cooperated.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: In a few days, you won’t have to watch because you’re going home. You’ll be getting your job back.

utterance.speaker: Safer
utterance.content: Everybody inside. Closing ceremonies. Everyone attends. One of you is going home.

utterance.speaker: Beasley
utterance.content: It’s been a great week. Um, a number of you have made tremendous strides. But today we’re here to congratulate Susan. We wish her well, and we hope

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: to never see her again!

utterance.speaker: Beasley
utterance.content: Yeah, isn’t it pretty?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where’s Freedom Master?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: He isn’t able to take part.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get out there. They said everybody has to get out there. Talk! Say something!

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Dr. House, leave him alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you drug him?

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: Of course I didn’t drug him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He has a flat affect. He’s practically catatonic.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: Hey, we got cake.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: He’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: Double chocolate. Yummy, yummy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t tell me that he’s fine! You did this. He was functioning. He was happy.

utterance.speaker: Medina
utterance.content: He was delusional.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s way better off now.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Dr. House. Let’s talk.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: Thinking sucks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m not allowed to get angry? They screwed him up. And for the record, I am two privilege levels above Susan. And I got the same depression-scale score.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Every patient is different. It’s not about scores and levels and –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Happiness is happiness. The test is the test. Coping is coping.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: And you think you’re –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absolutely! I need to address some deeper issues, which I can do on an outpatient basis. Three hours a week? And that’s just my opening offer. If you want to counter, I’ll likely fold.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: “No” is not an argument. Are you trying to frustrate me?

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: “No” again? I can cope! I’m coping. In fact… I’m coping better than you think. I’ve not been taking my meds. Not one. And yet, I still scored a “high functioning” on your depression test.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: So your proof of your well-being is that you lied?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Manipulated. My proof is that I can fool the test, I can fool you, which means I am high functioning. I am sane, rational, capable. I should not be here.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: These are your pills from today?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m not gonna take it. I’ll just cheek it again.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Lick it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want me to lick your hand?

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: I washed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s sugar.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Your test results were improving too regularly and too quickly. I was concerned that you weren’t taking your pills, that it was all an act, so I switched you to a placebo… to see if your improvements would continue. Your psych tests told me nothing, but your urine tests told me you were faking. You need to stop fighting the system. You need to let me do my job.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: So… what’s the next plan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There is no new plan. I’m out of plans.

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: So what do we do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We stop talking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I see you’ve got some cello in your trunk. And, no, that’s not a euphemism.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Are you spying on me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m living in a psychiatric hospital. Staring out of the window is what we do. I assume you’ll need help carrying it up. I still got grounds privileges.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: And who’s going to carry you when you’re carrying the cello?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, cast aside the useless cripple. How very German of you.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Seriously, the thing weighs a ton with that case. I think I need a dolly.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or we could ask Clark Kent to pitch in.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: The dolly’s probably easier.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eh, the dolly… already feels good about itself. He was a happy-go-lucky superhero until they told him he has no powers. We let him help out, he feels good about himself. Might be less depressed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So why do you put your life on hold to visit your sister-in-law five times a week?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Am I somehow a bad person for showing compassion?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. You’re not even a bad person for lying about why you’re doing it. Oh, that is impressive. That is a superhuman feat. Why don’t you take a rest before you fly that thing up to the ward? He’s still depressed. Give me your car keys.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: You gonna dangle them in front of him to entertain him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m gonna make him feel like he’s flying. I’ll just drive him around the grounds, top down, wind in his hair. Seriously… you’re gonna say no to that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you so nice to me?

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: I think you have a good heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would you still be nice to me if I told you that I lied? I’m not just driving around the grounds in your convertible. I’m kidnapping him and stealing your car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You sure? I was just starting to feel a little heat between us. Thought we had kind of a “Bonnie and Clyde” thing going there.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Bonnie and Clyde get shot to pieces.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. See you.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Whoo-hoo! Whoo! Whoo!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t let go!

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Aaah! Going up! Whooooo!

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Whoo! Freedom Master’s back!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep it down, Freedom Master.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Whoo!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re scaring the good citizens.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: That was the coolest moment of my life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was fun. You can repay me by telling Nolan he’s an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Smell that fresh air and the warmth of your yellow sun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We do enjoy it. Careful of the traffic. Hey! Hey! Come on, get down. There’s no cry for help. There’s no cat in a tree.

utterance.speaker: Freedom Master
utterance.content: Thank you, Greg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: NO!

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: He’s lucky to be alive. He’s got a lacerated spleen, rotational pelvic fracture, compound break of the femur and humerus. Everything in your life has been about finding the truth. But suddenly, with this guy, you decide to reinforce a sick man’s delusions. You just wanted to take a swing at me, hmm? You don’t care about getting out. You don’t care about him. You don’t even care about the truth. You don’t care about anything, House. I’m transferring you to Winslow Psychiatric. You’ll have better luck pulling the wool over their eyes. I’m done.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t. I need help.
